briefTitle: Povidone-iodine Against Sodium Hypochlorite as Skin Antiseptics
officialTitle: Comparative Study of 10% Povidone-iodine Against 10% Sodium Hypochlorite as Skin Antiseptics in Human Volunteers.
summary: The investigators have few options for skin antisepsis. Alternatives for povidone-iodine, which is the most commonly used agent, are costly or ineffective. To have more options, this study is needed. The investigators want to know if there are difference between the use of 10% sodium hypochlorite or 10% povidone-iodine for skin antisepsis.

primaryOutcome.measure: Bacterial Count of Skin Cultures for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
